intro: Alansmia xanthotrichia, commonly known as the yellow-haired alansmia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and showy, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid environments. Its leaves are usually opposite and covered in fine, yellowish hairs, contributing to its common name. Alansmia xanthotrichia is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands.
